foxtrot
Class Task

java.lang.Object
  foxtrot.Task
Direct Known Subclasses:
AsyncTask, Job
public abstract class Task
extends java.lang.Object

A time-consuming task to be executed in the Worker Thread that may throw checked exceptions.
Users must implement the run() method with the time-consuming code, and not worry about exceptions, for example: 

 Task task = new Task()
 {
     public Object run() throws InterruptedException
     {
        Thread.sleep(10000);
        return null;
     }
 };
Exceptions and Errors thrown by the run() method will be rethrown automatically by Worker.post(Task) or by ConcurrentWorker.post(Task)

Version:
$Revision: 1.13 $
See Also:
Worker, ConcurrentWorker

Method Detail

run

public abstract java.lang.Object run()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
The method to implement with time-consuming code. It should NOT be synchronized or synchronize on this Task instance, otherwise the AWT Event Dispatch Thread cannot efficiently test when this Task is completed.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getResultOrThrow

protected final java.lang.Object getResultOrThrow()
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the result of this Task operation, as set by setResult(java.lang.Object). If an exception or an error is thrown by run(), it is rethrown here. Synchronized since the variables are accessed from 2 threads Accessed from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
setResult(java.lang.Object), setThrowable(java.lang.Throwable)

getResult

private final java.lang.Object getResult()
Returns the result of this Task operation, as set by setResult(java.lang.Object). Synchronized since the variable is accessed from 2 threads Accessed from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread.

See Also:
getResultOrThrow()

setResult

final void setResult(java.lang.Object result)
Sets the result of this Task operation, as returned by the run() method. Synchronized since the variable is accessed from 2 threads Accessed from the worker thread. Package protected, used by AbstractWorkerThread

See Also:
getResultOrThrow(), getResult()

isCompleted

public final boolean isCompleted()
Returns whether the execution of this Task has been completed or not.

setCompleted

final void setCompleted(boolean value)
Sets the completion status of this Task. Synchronized since the variable is accessed from 2 threads. Accessed from the worker thread and from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread. Package protected, used by AbstractWorkerThread

reset

final void reset()
Resets the internal status of this Task, that can be therefore be reused. Synchronized since the variables are accessed from 2 threads Accessed from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread. Package protected, used by Worker

Callback invoked from the worker thread to perform some operation just after the Task has been completed.
